description:
The crash occurred in the southbound lanes of an undivided two-way roadway, with two lanes
                        of travel in each direction. The roadway was straight and level and had a posted speed limit of
                        48 kmph (30 mph). It was dark out but the roadway was lighted and it was dry.


                        Vehicle #1 was a 2002 Dodge Stratus, which was traveling southbound on the two-way roadway in
                        the right lane. Vehicle #2 was a 1993 Nissan Altima that was traveling southbound on the two-way
                        roadway in the left lane. On this roadway, Vehicle #1 was attempting to make a U-turn to travel
                        northbound when it was contacted on its left plane by Vehicle #2's frontal plane. The crash
                        occurred on a non-junction roadway with no traffic signs or signals. Both vehicles came to final
                        rest on the sidewalk of the northbound lanes.


                        A 27-year old male drove Vehicle #1, with no other occupants present. He sustained minor
                        injuries but was not transported to a medical facility. The Dodge Stratus was towed due to
                        damage.


                        The Critical Pre-Crash Event for Vehicle #1 was coded as: this vehicle traveling over the lane
                        line on left side of travel lane. The Critical Reason for the Critical Pre-Crash Event was coded
                        as an illegal maneuver, a decision error. The illegal maneuver was the attempted U-turn. An
                        associated factor coded to the driver of Vehicle #1 was inadequate surveillance.


                        Vehicle #2 was driven by a 22-year old male who had two occupants with him, a 15-year old female
                        in the front-right position and a 16-year old female in the back-right seat. All three occupants
                        sustained minor injuries and were transported to a medical facility. The Nissan Altima was also
                        towed due to damage.


                        The Critical Pre-Crash Event for Vehicle #2 was coded as: other vehicle encroachment, from
                        adjacent lane (same direction)-over right lane line. The Critical Reason for the Critical Event
                        was not coded to this vehicle. No associated factors were coded to this driver. The driver of
                        Vehicle #2 could not be located for an interview. He was not thought to have contributed to the
                        crash.
